p: The method described by Peter et al. [ 26] was utilized to carry out the in vivo schizontocidal activity of the extract against early chloroquine-sensitive P. berghei infection. On the first day (D 0), an apparently healthy mouse in each group was coded and inoculated with 0.2 ml of blood containing about 1 × 10 7 P. berghei-infected RBCs. Then, three hours after infection (D 0), each animal in each group was weighed and orally provided with the corresponding dosage of the extract and the controls using oral gavage for four consecutive days (D 0-D 3). At the beginning of D 0 and/or at the end of the 4 th day (D 4), the parameters detailed below were determined and the mice were monitored daily for 30 days to evaluate their survival time [ 26].
